Create a course website

Expand all / Collapse all

Basic settings
*

e.g. History of Literature
*

max. 12 characters, ie.ROM2121




Feel free not to associate courses to any categories.
The categories appearing in grey are invisible categories.
*
Course access *
 
 
 
Registration settings *
 
 
   
 
 
By default, all users registered to the platform can enrol to your course. If you want some confidentiality, the simplest way is to open registration during one week, ask the students to register themselves, then close registration and check for possible intruders in the user list. Another option is to define a registration key which will need to be entered by any student who wants to enrol to the course.
Optionnal settings
Advanced options
Course visibility
 
 
Maximum number of students

Leave this field empty or use 0 if you don't want to limit the number of users in this course
This limit doesn't include course's tutors and managers
Status

      (d/m/y)
 
 
 
 
 

* denotes required field

Basic settings
*
*




Feel free not to associate courses to any categories.
The categories appearing in grey are invisible categories.
*
Course access *
 
 
 
Registration settings *
 
 
   
 
 
By default, all users registered to the platform can enrol to your course. If you want some confidentiality, the simplest way is to open registration during one week, ask the students to register themselves, then close registration and check for possible intruders in the user list. Another option is to define a registration key which will need to be entered by any student who wants to enrol to the course.

Advanced options
Course visibility
 
 
Maximum number of students

Leave this field empty or use 0 if you don't want to limit the number of users in this course
This limit doesn't include course's tutors and managers

Basic settings

e.g. History of Literature

Course access *
 
 
 
Registration settings *
 
 
   
 
 
By default, all users registered to the platform can enrol to your course. If you want some confidentiality, the simplest way is to open registration during one week, ask the students to register themselves, then close registration and check for possible intruders in the user list. Another option is to define a registration key which will need to be entered by any student who wants to enrol to the course.
